meanings.definition: Agorae: plural form of agora, a public open space used for assemblies and markets.
meanings.sent1: The agorae in ancient Greece were bustling with activity.
meanings.sent2: The marketplace was located in the agorae of the city.
meanings.sent3: The farmers brought their goods to the agorae to sell, but ended up trading stories instead.
meanings.sent4: The agorae of the city was a melting pot of different cultures and traditions.
meanings.sent5: The sound of chatter and laughter filled the agorae, creating a vibrant atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Agorae: a place of gathering and social interaction in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: The local community would often meet at the agorae to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent2: Friends gathered at the agorae to catch up and share news.
meanings.sent3: The children turned the agorae into their playground, much to the amusement of the elders.
meanings.sent4: The agorae served as the heart of the city, connecting people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun shone down on the agorae, creating a welcoming space for all who visited.
